content: The "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" is the short title of this Act. It outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007 outlines the establishment and powers of the Commission, including a limitation on members' federal employee status and the acceptance of matching funds for projects. The Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007 allows the Commission to accept matching funds for approved projects and amends personnel matters regarding Commission members. The Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007 allows the Commission to accept matching funds for approved projects and amends personnel matters regarding Commission members, including compensation waivers for non-government members. The Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007 allows Federal Government officers or employees to waive compensation and amends personnel matters for Commission members. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to terminate appointed personnel and change the Economic Development Committee's section to allow for discretion in decision-making. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to give special functions to the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize the Secretary of Labor to make lump sum payments for a training program on careers related to infrastructure development in rural Alaska, focusing on construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 prioritizes training for construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects, management training, initiatives for Alaskan youths, and training for public infrastructure projects. Amounts allocated to the Commission remain available until expended. Additionally, the Act includes provisions for teacher housing. Amounts allocated to the Commission remain available until expended. The Commission is also authorized to provide assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska, including housing development activities like acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction of housing. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 prioritizes training for construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects, including activities such as the acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction of housing, as well as multisite rehabilitation. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date of the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
